over a field of characteristic zero, when the Killing form is non-singular

nodes.body:
This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#13076~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (ðŸ¤–). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->
Thank you for the very helpful review!

Thanks :tada:

bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9190991794/job/25276450999)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9190991794/job/25276450405)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9190991794/job/25276449597)

I've reviewed the part on sl2-triples. If you process the comments, and split it into a separate PR, then that can be an easy merge afterwards.

I'll try to review the rest asap.
Nitpick: how about `k` instead of `z` for the natural number?
Have you also considered a predicate that takes `e`, `f` and `h` as arguments?
I did consider this and I don't have a good answer: it seems like either design would be fine. I'm happy to switch or even to push up a commit demonstrating the change if you'd like to see it.

I think we will rarely (never) want to consider the type of all sl2-triples in a Lie algera. Hence I'm leaning slightly towards the predicate version. If you don't mind testing it out, please go ahead!
OK I've pushed up a commit making this change. I think it probably is the better design.
Nice! Do you think this PR is also a good place to add an example of the "canonical" sl2-triple? Namely the one for sl2 itself?
This raises issues about what should import what which I'd rather defer.

```suggestion
@[simp] lemma symm_iff : IsSl2Triple (-h) f e â†” IsSl2Triple h e f :=
  âŸ¨fun t â†¦ neg_neg h â–¸ t.symm, symmâŸ©
```
Thanks, done (in #13076)

```suggestion
  __ := t
```
Thanks, done (in #13076)

Feel free to ignore this nitpick/suggestion.
```suggestion
  Â· have aux : (-2 + (Î¼ - 2 * â†‘n) : R) = Î¼ - 2 * (â†‘n + 1) := by ring
    rw [pow_succ', LinearMap.mul_apply, toEndomorphism_apply_apply, Nat.cast_add, Nat.cast_one,
      leibniz_lie h, P.lie_lie_smul_f R, â† neg_smul, ih, lie_smul, smul_lie, â† add_smul, aux]
```
I decided to pass over this (arguably the existing structure is more robust)

```suggestion
    exact this.resolve_left <| Nat.cast_add_one_ne_zero n
```
Thanks, done (in #13076)
This term is quite complicated... also you are shadowing `hs` (the head symbol of the term) inside the proof in the `fun âŸ¨s, hsâŸ©` clauses... maybe use `r, hr` there?
Thanks, done (in #13076)
Are we missing `Set.infinite_range_iff`?
Good point, added and used (in #13076)

Please feel free to improve the name. This lemma allows you to golf two proofs below, because they have a common tail.
```suggestion

variable {K L H} in
lemma lie_eq_killingForm_smul_of_mem_rootSpace_of_mem_rootSpace_neg_aux
    {Î± : Weight K H L} {e f : L} (heÎ± : e âˆˆ rootSpace H Î±) (hfÎ± : f âˆˆ rootSpace H (-Î±))
    (aux : âˆ€ (h : H), â…h, eâ† = Î± h â€¢ e) :
    â…e, fâ† = killingForm K L e f â€¢ (cartanEquivDual H).symm Î± := by
  set Î±' := (cartanEquivDual H).symm Î±
  rw [â† sub_eq_zero, â† Submodule.mem_bot (R := K), â† ker_killingForm_eq_bot]
  apply mem_ker_killingForm_of_mem_rootSpace_of_forall_rootSpace_neg (Î± := (0 : H â†’ K))
  Â· simp only [rootSpace_zero_eq, LieSubalgebra.mem_toLieSubmodule]
    refine sub_mem ?_ (H.smul_mem _ Î±'.property)
    simpa using mapsTo_toEndomorphism_weightSpace_add_of_mem_rootSpace K L H L Î± (-Î±) heÎ± hfÎ±
  Â· intro z hz
    replace hz : z âˆˆ H := by simpa using hz
    have he : â…z, eâ† = Î± âŸ¨z, hzâŸ© â€¢ e := aux âŸ¨z, hzâŸ©
    have hÎ±z : killingForm K L Î±' (âŸ¨z, hzâŸ© : H) = Î± âŸ¨z, hzâŸ© :=
      LinearMap.BilinForm.apply_toDual_symm_apply (hB := traceForm_cartan_nondegenerate K L H) _ _
    simp [traceForm_comm K L L â…e, fâ†, â† traceForm_apply_lie_apply, he, mul_comm _ (Î± âŸ¨z, hzâŸ©), hÎ±z]

```
Thanks; I think the name is fine: this is a classical auxiliary lemma.

```suggestion
  exact lie_eq_killingForm_smul_of_mem_rootSpace_of_mem_rootSpace_neg_aux heÎ± hfÎ± he
```

You can now prove this with
```
  apply lie_eq_killingForm_smul_of_mem_rootSpace_of_mem_rootSpace_neg_aux heÎ± hfÎ±
  exact lie_eq_smul_of_mem_rootSpace heÎ±
```

Not sure about this one
```suggestion
    (corootSpace Î±).toSubmodule = K âˆ™ (cartanEquivDual H).symm Î± := by
```

Pretty sure about this one
```suggestion
    have : {â…y, zâ† | (y âˆˆ rootSpace H Î±) (z âˆˆ rootSpace H (-Î±))} âŠ†
```

```suggestion
    rw [lie_smul, lie_smul, smul_lie, this]
    simp [â† smul_assoc, f', hh, mul_comm _ (2 * (Î± h)â»Â¹)]
```
What do you think of swapping the names of `f` and `f'` to indicate which one is tmp and which on is the "final candidate"?
Done!

```suggestion
lemma _root_.IsSl2Triple.h_eq_coroot {Î± : Weight K H L} (hÎ± : Î±.IsNonZero)
```
Do you think that makes sense?
Yep

This proof is somewhat fragile, because it relies on `simp` first using `map_smul` and only then using `Weight.toLinear_apply`.
It seems that we don't have an instance of `LinearMapClass` for `Weight`. I guess that would fix this issue.
```suggestion
    replace this : s = 1 := by
      rw [map_smul] at this
      simpa [root_apply_coroot hÎ±, key] using this
```
I actually just realised I should create the `LinearMapClass` instance the other day but hadn't had a chance to implement it. Now done!

How about
```suggestion
  lift h to H using by simpa only [â† ht.lie_e_f, hef] using H.smul_mem _ (Submodule.coe_mem _)
  congr 1
```
and then using `h` everywhere instead of `h'`?
Thanks; done.

If you switch to the `lift h` approach, then you can use
```suggestion
    simpa [this, ZeroMemClass.coe_eq_zero] using h_eq
```

```suggestion
    { __ := ht.symm
```

```suggestion
  obtain âŸ¨n, hnâŸ© : âˆƒ n : â„•, (-2 : K) = n := P.exists_nat
  replace hn : -2 = (n : â„¤) := by norm_cast at hn
```

I reposted the comment below on the new PR: https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/13076/files#r1607915269

```quote
After a bit more mulling over this, I'm wondering whether `extends` is the right choice. Maybe the triple should be a parameter. That seems to be how you use it in practice anyways. (And then `h e f` could possibly be implicit parameters.)

No strong opinion though.
```
